Context: The Tommy Douglas Institute is a site for critical discourse on ethical role of post-secondary education in the 21st century, launched in 2013. It invites participants from colleges and universities and communities to explore ideas of critical and socially just pedagogy. Annual events include breakout sessions, interactive exhibits, and a closing community forum with inspiring keynote speakers. Some past speakers include Henry Giroux, Judy Rebick, Shirley Douglas, Olivia Chow, and Chris Hedges. To stay updated, sign up for their mailing list using the provided contact information. The Institute aims to bring together colleges, universities and communities to explore possibilities of educating for social justice. The text includes contacts: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The text also mentions a land acknowledgment and social media hub.
